alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 23 at 8:45PM CDT until July 26 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Nebraska... North Platte River at North Platte affecting Lincoln County. For the North Platte River...including North Platte...elevated river levels are forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 845 AM CDT. && ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR A DAM FLOODGATE RELEASE REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by upstream dam release continues. * WHERE...North Platte River at North Platte. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Minor flood stage. Minor flooding begins in low lying and agricultural areas along the south bank of the North Platte River. Flooding of yards between the golf course and Buffalo Bill Campground are possible. Minor water intrusions into low lying areas of Cody Park in North Platte begins. People should use caution in the water and along the banks of the river, especially near Cody Park. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 6.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 PM CDT Saturday was 6.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Monday morning and continue falling to 5.8 feet Thursday morning. - Action stage is 5.5 feet. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
